sentence.text: However, the prevalence and spectrum of NKX2-5 mutations associated with sporadic DCM remain to be evaluated.

In this study, the coding regions and flanking introns of the NKX2-5 gene, which encodes a cardiac transcription factor pivotal for cardiac development and structural remodeling, were sequenced in 210 unrelated patients with sporadic adult-onset DCM.
As a result, two novel heterozygous NKX2-5 mutations, p.R139W and p.E167X, were identified in 2 unrelated patients with sporadic adult-onset DCM, with a mutational prevalence of approximately 0.95%.

This study is the first to associate NKX2-5 loss-of-function mutations with enhanced susceptibility to sporadic DCM, which provides novel insight into the molecular etiology underpinning DCM, and suggests the potential implications for the genetic counseling and personalized treatment of the DCM patients
